memberdef.argsstring: (const cugraph_resource_handle_t *handle, cugraph_graph_t *graph, cugraph_type_erased_device_array_view_t *sources, bool_t direction_optimizing, size_t depth_limit, bool_t compute_predecessors, bool_t do_expensive_check, cugraph_paths_result_t **result, cugraph_error_t **error)
memberdef.name: cugraph_bfs

briefdescription.para: Perform a breadth first search from a set of seed vertices.

detaileddescription.para: This function computes the distances (minimum number of hops to reach the vertex) from the source vertex. If predecessors is not NULL, this function calculates the predecessor of each vertex (parent vertex in the breadth-first search tree) as well.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to graph FIXME: Make this just [in], copy it if I need to temporarily modify internally
Array of source vertices. NOTE: Array might be modified if renumbering is enabled for the graph

If set to true, this algorithm switches between the push based breadth-first search and pull based breadth-first search depending on the size of the breadth-first search frontier (currently unsupported). This option is valid only for symmetric input graphs.
Sets the maximum number of breadth-first search iterations. Any vertices farther than depth_limit hops from source_vertex will be marked as unreachable.
A flag to indicate whether to compute the predecessors in the result
A flag to run expensive checks for input arguments (if set to true).
Pointer to an error object storing details of any error. Will be populated if error code is not CUGRAPH_SUCCESS
